optimization_strategies.description: Reduce material in low-stress regions (typically arm centers). Maintain stiffness near motor mounts and central hub.
optimization_strategies.target: Minimize mass while keeping safety factor > 1.5.

optimization_strategies.description: Streamline arm cross-sections (airfoil shape vs. square/round) to reduce drag.
Limit overhangs to 45 degrees. Use modular arms for easy replacement.
optimization_strategies.target: Reduce support material and print time.

optimization_strategies.description: Use interlocking, screwless mechanisms inspired by traditional Japanese joinery to join arms to the body.
optimization_strategies.benefits: Eliminates metal fasteners (weight reduction), reduces stress concentrations, enables tool-free 'repair-first' arm replacement.
optimization_strategies.design_intent: Repair-First Design Philosophy for sub-250g FPV frames.

optimization_strategies.description: Evaluate designs using weighted KPIs based on component function.

component_layout_rules.location: Upper plate, enclosed in screwed support.
component_layout_rules.reason: Optimal satellite reception and mechanical protection.
Adjust Center of Gravity (CoG) forward for better forward-flight response.

component_layout_rules.location: Top plate, secured with Velcro strap through recesses.

aerodynamics.benefit: Significantly reduces parasitic drag at forward flight speeds > 10 m/s.
Embed wiring internally to reduce drag and snag hazards.

reference_weights.sub_250g_target: For micro-class drones, total weight < 250g is critical for regulatory compliance.

design_rules.description: Prioritize specific stiffness over absolute strength.
Use parametric constraints to allow rapid iteration of arm length and thickness. (Software: 3DEXPERIENCE, Autodesk Inventor)
Validate designs with static FEA (load = 4x hover thrust on arm tip) before prototyping.
